intro: Pedicularis plicata, commonly known as the wrinkled lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Pedicularis plicata thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas where it forms part of the alpine flora.
